WRITING.TEXT: Just because Kagero became the awkward stepchild of the IJN DD line doesn't mean the whole game has gone to shit, my friend.
They were simply trying to make Kagero into the same playstyle they're trying to make Shimakaze with high risk high reward. It does it worse than shima, of course, but it's not a T11 ship.

I've stated this many times to others, but Gearing and Fletcher are not the contributing torpedo soup because of their quantity, damage, and speed of torpedoes. They still need to get closer to the enemy which puts them into counterable range where teamwork can take them out.
If and by hotkey counters you mean radar, it's funny because in our scrims a few teams have tried to use radar ships but generally it's incredibly difficult to use it effectively if the enemy team plays well as it is hard to get cruisers into range and have enough firepower to take out DDs in time. From my perspective, most changes they've made to game make teamwork better, which I can't complain about.

Kagero is still the stealthiest ship on the sea, which counts for a lot. The inability to counter hovering planes is also a problem for the other two DD lines as well unless you're an AA spec US DD. I still don't see the problem. Use teamwork and get your CV to help out and/or get closer to friendly ships.
Edit - it seems you changed your whole post since I saw it and started my reply

Destroyers kinda need to be hard to play or they'd be ridiculous. In competitive play, countering the enemy destroyers is generally the hardest thing to do as they play close to the fleet and it's hard to get cruisers into good range of them so you have to use a combination of your DDs + air cover to neutralize them. I don't really see the problem with this, tbh.
I don't understand what is wrong with what DM said that you find game quitting worthy. Explain?
As silly as it is to buy headphones without doing appropriate research, people finding it helpful that this guy points out a lack of noise cancellation is them doing appropriate research.

You're right, mostly. It's pretty strong though. I play in competitive clan vs clan stuff and Kutuzov is the most used cruiser, even more than Atago.

It's as much of a PSA with twice the amount of misinformation.

All I see in that thread was a bunch of anecdotal evidence of that one time someone was spotted for 4 minutes and pinpoint accuracy and such and such. I wanted to make a thread of what I tested as real world application of how these changes are affecting playstyle.
Ah I see. Very good to know but this still won't change the length of this penalty to being in smoke lasting longer than 3 seconds from what I can tell. Hopefully war gaming are working on this.
I see nothing in that thread that backs up such a statement as server discrepancy causing 3-20 seconds of difference for this penalty. Am I missing something?

WRITING.TITLE: PSA - There is a 3 second penalty to going undetected in smoke
WRITING.TEXT:
I've seen a lot of talk about the Situational Awareness bug and the changes to spotting. There have been a few changes to the way that debuffs are applied but I have not done much testing on these. What we did test however is the most relevant change which is a 3 second penalty to going undetected in smoke which is NOT REPORTED BY SITUATIONAL AWARENESS. We tested this last night and confirmed it that for 3 seconds after SA reports you being invisible in smoke, the enemy can still see you.
Sometimes it feels like it is longer than 3 seconds but you have to keep in mind that if you pop in and out of smoke a couple times (from slowing down or such) the penalty is applied every time. So you have to be careful at what speed you are going when smoking.
As an aside, it was tested in a Benson that you could not go 1/4 speed while remaining fully undetected setting up the smoke. I don't remember it being like this before but I am not 100% sure this is a change and not anecdotal.
Edit - It is worth pointing out that among all the confusion about SA being bugged the only time we have found SA to be reporting inaccurately is for this smoke penalty. In every other case it seems SA is working fine, but if someone finds something else wrong please let me know.

It's not longer than 3 seconds. It's been tested by more than anecdotal observation. If you pop in and out of smoke though, the 3 second penalty gets applied every time which would make it seem longer.
It's more of a nerf to using smoke screens that simply a spotting mechanic.
All these reports of it being an extra 10 or 20 seconds are exaggerated. It's a 3 second penalty to entering smoke. Been tested a lot.

Did some testing with this last night. It seems there is a 3 second penalty to entering smoke and a 2-3km penalty for being on fire. SA simply doesn't report those extra 3 seconds in smoke. Is there more to this bug than that?
What an amazing picture.
Yeah man fuck everyone for liking something you don't like. It's only popular because of bourgeois propaganda anyway not because it's good or anything.
Kripp?
Nah, because the consistency of full pens and citadel hits will make up for the fewer amount of shells. MK has the biggest cruiser citadel for the tier as well

Good write up. Though , as someone with over 100 games played in the MK, I would not want to fight a heavy cruiser 1v1. Especially a hipper. Unless they are just giving you broadside at 8km, MK AP shells don't citadel other cruisers very well. If I have to engage a heavy cruiser at 12km+, I'll probably lose.
Blizzard is notorious for over nerfing things in every game they make. And rarely if ever do they go back and buff them.

That said I cut everyone a lot of slack at low levels because everyone is bad and new.
-subject2159

Such a high quality shitpost getting this few amount of upvotes speaks to the disconnect I have with this sub. However, I do not take this as a loss. I see the prospect of a world filled with shitposts and it fills me with determination.
I think it's not unfair to say that some games can have a reasonable expectation of other player's participation of the game's meta.

Just playing the game involves picking a good comp. I mean pubs are a little more care free, sure, but the entire point of the game is a good comp and team coordination. If you don't want to participate in that then you're going to be ruining other people's attempt at playing correctly. That said I cut everyone a lot of slack at low levels because everyone is bad and new.

WRITING.TITLE: Comprehensive guide to effective T10 strategy. Steps by steps for all classes!
WRITING.TEXT:
We all know that T10 gameplay offers diverse and interactive teamplay. But it can be a bit daunting and counter-intuitive for new players to succeed in waters saturated with T11 ships. And now that T10 is much more affordable to play and more players than ever are getting there, this comprehensive guide should help many players.
~~Step 0 - sell your T10 ships and play something more fun~~
Step 1 - Get your mind right. This is serious boating action you better fuckin be serious about it.
Step 2 - Play a T11 ship. Balanced ships are bad ships. Go OP or go home and teach those Montana's what it means to actually be the top tier.
Step 3 - Group up with a division and do coordinated shit.
~~Step 4 - When you start getting shot at blame your teammates.~~
Lemme start over. I'm getting side tracked.
Step 1 - When the match starts, don't do anything for 10 minutes. He who pushes first dies. The enemy will get impatient and start trickling in. You can snowball from here.
~~Step 2 - If you bring an Erie, MM will compensate your team with more T10 ships.~~
Ugh sometimes I really don't even.
~~Step 1 - If the enemy has the DD advantage you've probably already lost unless there are huge amount of potato.~~
FUCK
Step 1 - If your team starts pushing before that 10 minute mark, cuss them out but I guess you may as well join them because fuck it you're about to lose anyway.
Step 2 - It turns out that planes are really good in this game for spotting and helping control caps. You should think about picking up CVs ~~and actually being useful for once for your team.~~
Step 4 - Be nice to your teammates. Chances are they are people too in most cases and people are pretty cool. I mean we're probably all going to die in a couple decades to massive weather changes caused by global warming #bushdid9/11 so just have fun fam
Eh, good enough.
It's all good man you made a good point too.
I'll give it an upvote.
